derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (as a term in Christian theology): via Old French from ecclesiastical Latin incarnatio(n-), from the verb incarnare (see incarnate)

entry.def: If you say that someone is the incarnation of a particular quality, you mean that they represent that quality or are typical of it in an extreme form.

example.ex: The regime was the very incarnation of evil...
example.tran: 该政权正是罪恶的化身。

example.ex: She is a perfect incarnation of glamour.

entry.def: An incarnation is an instance of being alive on earth in a particular form. Some religions believe that people have several incarnations in different forms.

example.ex: She began recalling a series of previous incarnations...
example.tran: 她开始回忆起前世的种种情形。

example.ex: His industry and persistence suggest that he was an ant in a previous incarnation.
example.tran: 他的勤奋与坚持表明他前世是只蚂蚁。

means.word_mean: 1. a new personification of a familiar idea;
2. time passed in a particular bodily form;

sentences.sentence: "he believes that his life will be better in his next incarnation"

means.word_mean: 3. the act of attributing human characteristics to abstract ideas etc.

auth_sentence.content: Since its earliest incarnation, football has been tribal.
